topics: The Law as a tutor/guide to Christ
The curse of the law and Christâ€™s redemption
The Abrahamic covenant and faith as righteousness
The Holy Spirit as witness to righteousness
The cross as the curse-bearing instrument
The purpose of the Law (righteous standard, exposure of sin, need for Savior)
sentimentFlow: The sermon starts heavy, rebuking the audience for foolishness and emphasizing the crushing weight of sin, failure, and curse under the law that no one can fully keep. It intensifies this conviction by showing how the law reveals our deep flaws and inability to save ourselves. It then shifts light, celebrating Christ's rescue from the curse, the freedom of faith, and an uplifting invitation to forgiveness and joy.
